description: Enterprise techniques used by Torisma, ATT&CK software S0678 (v1.2)
name: Torisma (S0678)

techniques.comment: [Torisma](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0678) can use HTTP and HTTPS for C2 communications.(Citation: McAfee Lazarus Nov 2020)
[Torisma](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0678) has encoded C2 communications with Base64.(Citation: McAfee Lazarus Nov 2020)
[Torisma](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0678) has used XOR and Base64 to decode C2 data.(Citation: McAfee Lazarus Nov 2020)
[Torisma](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0678) has encrypted its C2 communications using XOR and VEST-32.(Citation: McAfee Lazarus Nov 2020)
[Torisma](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0678) is only delivered to a compromised host if the victim's IP address is on an allow-list.(Citation: McAfee Lazarus Nov 2020)
[Torisma](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0678) can send victim data to an actor-controlled C2 server.(Citation: McAfee Lazarus Nov 2020)
[Torisma](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0678) has used various Windows API calls.(Citation: McAfee Lazarus Nov 2020)
[Torisma](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0678) has been packed with Iz4 compression.(Citation: McAfee Lazarus Nov 2020)
[Torisma](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0678) has been Base64 encoded and AES encrypted.(Citation: McAfee Lazarus Nov 2020)

[Torisma](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0678) can use `GetlogicalDrives` to get a bitmask of all drives available on a compromised system. It can also use `GetDriveType` to determine if a new drive is a CD-ROM drive.(Citation: McAfee Lazarus Nov 2020)
[Torisma](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0678) can collect the local MAC address using `GetAdaptersInfo` as well as the system's IP address.(Citation: McAfee Lazarus Nov 2020)
[Torisma](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0678) can use `WTSEnumerateSessionsW` to monitor remote desktop connections.(Citation: McAfee Lazarus Nov 2020)
[Torisma](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0678) can collect the current time on a victim machine.(Citation: McAfee Lazarus Nov 2020)
